page.title: 03BROWNIES HIGH ERCALL
page.content: The Brownies meet on Monday. They have not always been called Brownies. When it first started the girls called themselves the Roses. The name was changed when the Roses got unhappy with their name and Baden_Powell told them the story of Tommy and Betty, then the name was changed to Brownies. The Brownies meet from 6.00pm to 7.30 pm in the Village Hall. There are 22 Brownies some of them arent enrolled yet. They have got 1 Brown Owl, 2 Guides. 1 Helper, and 1 Young Leader. They have a pack holiday every year, and loads of Fundays and Fetes.At Brownies they play games like, Traffic lights, Hospital beds,running and stuck in the mud. They also sing campfire songs, make sweets, have coffee evenings and make things like the Union Jack. By Caroline Stansfield and Sarah Preston.
